text: Daniel
Daniel’s Development in the King’s Court
In \add the\add* third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and besieged it.

And the Lord gave Jehoiakim the king of Judah into his hand and ⸤some of⸥\f + \fr 1:2 \ft Literally “from the end/extremity/limits” \f* of the utensils of the temple of God,\f + \fr 1:2 \ft Hebrew “the God” \f* and he brought them \add to\add* the land of Shinar \add to\add* the temple of his gods, and he brought the utensils to ⸤the treasury⸥\f + \fr 1:2 \ft Literally “the house of the treasury” \f* of his gods.

And the king ⸤ordered⸥\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Literally “said to” \f* Ashpenaz, the commander of his court officials, to bring ⸤some of the Israelites⸥\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Literally “from the sons/children of Israel” \f* from ⸤the royal family⸥\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Literally “from the seed of the kingship” \f* and from the lords,\f + \fr 1:3 \ft Or “nobles” \f*

youths who ⸤have no physical defect⸥,\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Literally “there is not in them any physical defect” \f* and \add who are\add* ⸤handsome⸥,\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Literally “good/pleasing of appearance” \f* and \add who are\add* prudent\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Or “insightful” \f* in all wisdom and ⸤endowed with knowledge⸥,\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Literally “\fq who have \ft knowledge of knowledge” \f* and \add who\add* understand insight, and who \add have\add* the ⸤ability⸥\f + \fr 1:4 \ft Literally “strength” \f* in them to serve in the palace of the king. \add And the king ordered him\add* to teach them the literature and the language of \add the\add* Chaldeans.

And the king assigned to them ⸤his daily portion⸥\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft portion of the day on its day” \f* from the fine food of the king, and from ⸤the wine that he drank⸥,\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Literally “the wine of his drink” \f* and \add instructed that\add* ⸤they were to be educated for three years⸥.\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Literally “and to be educated them years three” \f* And at the end \add of\add* their \add training\add*, ⸤they were to be stationed⸥\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Literally “they would stand” \f* ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 1:5 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* the king.
Now there was among them ⸤from the Judeans⸥,\f + \fr 1:6 \ft Literally “from the children of Judah” \f* Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael and Azariah.
And the commander of the court officials gave them names, and he called Daniel, Belteshazzar; and Hananiah, Shadrach; and Mishael, Meshach; and Azariah, Abednego.
Daniel’s Resolve

Now ⸤Daniel resolved⸥\f + \fr 1:8 \ft Literally “Daniel placed upon his heart” \f* that he would not defile himself with the fine food of the king, and with ⸤the wine that he drank⸥,\f + \fr 1:8 \ft Literally “the wine of his drink” \f* and \add so\add* he requested from the commander of the court officials \add permission so\add* that he would not defile himself.
And God\f + \fr 1:9 \ft Hebrew “the God” \f* gave Daniel favor and compassion ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 1:9 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* the commander of the court officials,

and the commander of the court officials said to Daniel, “I \add am\add* afraid \add of\add* my lord, the king, who has determined your food and your drink, for ⸤why should⸥\f + \fr 1:10 \ft Literally “to what would” \f* he see your face having a worse appearance than the young men who ⸤are your age⸥?\f + \fr 1:10 \ft Literally “like your age”; “your” is plural \f* Then you will endanger my head with the king.”

Then\f + \fr 1:11 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Daniel asked the guard\f + \fr 1:11 \ft Or “overseer” \f* whom the commander of the court officials \add had\add* appointed over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah,
“Please test your servants \add for\add* ten days, and let them give us ⸤some of the vegetables⸥,\f + \fr 1:12 \ft Literally “from the vegetables” \f* and let us eat and let us drink water.

Then\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* let our appearances and the appearance of the young men who are eating the fine food of the king be compared ⸤before you⸥,\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Literally “in your presence” \f* and \add then\add* deal with your servants ⸤according to what you see⸥.”\f + \fr 1:13 \ft Literally “and according to/that you see” \f*
So he agreed to this proposal with them, and he tested them \add for\add* ten days.
And at the end of ten days their appearances appeared better and \add they were\add* healthier of body than all the young men who were eating the fine food of the king.

⸤So⸥\f + \fr 1:16 \ft Literally “And it happened” \f* the guard ⸤continued to withhold⸥\f + \fr 1:16 \ft Literally “he was … withdrawing” \f* their fine food and the wine of their drink, and he gave them\f + \fr 1:16 \ft Hebrew “to them” \f* vegetables.

⸤And as for these four young men⸥,\f + \fr 1:17 \ft Literally “And these young men, four of them” \f* God\f + \fr 1:17 \ft Hebrew “the God” \f* gave to them knowledge and insight into all literature and wisdom, and Daniel had insight into all visions\f + \fr 1:17 \ft Hebrew “vision” \f* and dreams.
And at the end of the time the king had set to bring them, the commander of the court officials brought them in ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 1:18 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* Nebuchadnezzar.

And the king spoke with them, ⸤and among all of them no one was found like⸥\f + \fr 1:19 \ft Literally “and he was not found from all of them like” \f* Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah; then they stood ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 1:19 \ft Literally “to the face of” \f* the king.

And in every matter of wisdom \add and\add* understanding \add about\add* which the king inquired from them, he found them ten times better \add than\add* all \add of\add* the magicians\f + \fr 1:20 \ft Or “soothsayer-priests” \f* \add and\add* conjurers\f + \fr 1:20 \ft Or “enchanters” \f* that ⸤were in his entire kingdom⸥.\f + \fr 1:20 \ft Literally “in the whole of his kingdom” \f*
And Daniel was \add there\add* until the first year of Cyrus the king.
